Reviews.Content: Disappointment If you are looking for backpackers accomodation with minimal comfort, this hotel is then perfect for you. There is no fridge/mini bar, old tv with no good reception, breakfast was terrible (not much choice really), in the extremelly small toilet they've managed to squeeze in the shower (only marked with separating curtains) and the sink and the toilet bowl...not sure how they managed..Location not very good either...you can notice a lot of shady characters creeping around...especially when it gets dark...Staff were ok, but there is not much really they can help you with.
Reviews.Author: maci0202

Reviews.Content: We got lucky We booked this hotel for 50 Euros a night in August, and were supposed to get a double room with a shared bathroom down the hall. Instead, the hotel messed up our reservation and gave us probably the nicest room in the hotel. We had a queen bed, a private bathroom, a TV, and a lot of space. And we paid the same rate we had booked for. Oh, and we were supposed to have to haul our luggage up to the third floor, but this room was on the main floor.The staff were friendly, but not always easy to communicate with. The night man, while very friendly, spoke no English, and apparently my Italian was nearly unintelligible to him (probably true). The woman during the day spoke a lot more English, and was very helpful. She booked us a day trip out to Siena and Pisa, which was a highlight of our trip.Overall, we had a great experience. The train station is two blocks away, the river is two blocks away, and the old city centre is no more than 10 minutes walk away. It was a great place to stay, but then, we got a little lucky on the room switch. If we had gotten the room we were supposed to, I doubt we'd have liked it as much.
Reviews.Author: cfrydj

Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel This hotel is located just about two blocks from the train station. The hotel is on a nice side street with three or four restaurants. The only shortcoming with this hotel is the tall flight of stairs to the lobby. The owner did come down and take up our luggage and toted it down on checkout. Our room was very large and had a private terrace. We think we had the only terrace in the hotel. There is no in room safe or mini-bar. Breakfast is minimal, but good and the hotel is very clean. Would stay again.
Reviews.Author: rnlmcs

Reviews.Content: Hotel Palazzuolo: clean  we booked three days at the Palazzuolo Hotel, following some good reviews in TripadvisorThe Hotel is a 1 star, and that's what U get.We got quite a big room, with a third bed we didn't need.The hotel is very clean, but very basic: we had only one towel each, and there were only 2 soap bars in the bathroom.We didn't choose breakfast, so we couldn't check it.The hotel position is very good: 5 minutes from the station, Santa Maria Novella and the river Arno, 15-20 minutes from Piazza della Signoria.The area may seem a bit scruffy, but is becoming more and more vibrant, with good trattorias and cheap pubs (we had a spirit and a pint of beer for 2.5 euros each, in a pub very near to the hotel).It's not a bad value for money, for 75 euros the double room with bath, but for the same money, if U're lucky, U can get nicer BBs all over Florence.A negative note: the night before leaving, we were asked by the concierge to pay in advance, so I had to point out that it wasn't my use to escape at night (especially for such a small sum), and that in any rate I placed a credit card booking, so there was no problem in any case...
Reviews.Author: Giobatta

Reviews.Content: dreadful This place looked ok on its website and had some good reviews on Tripadvisor. On arrival we were dissapointed by the lack of ny comforts in the room. The room can only be described as being a 'monks cell' all it had in it was two single beds and a bere table there was no TV or phone. The breakfast consisted of croissants or toast in plastic wrappers and cold coffee which had to be heated in a microwave. The ensuite shower was appalingly laid out and decrepid. They had the cheek to ask for 鈧?00 per night. When compared to nearby hotels thisplace is not worth 鈧?0 per night - Avoid thisone like the plague.
Reviews.Author: Subaru1

Reviews.Content: great little quiet hotel, very easy to walk to the sights this hotel was very easy to walk to from the train station.safe  cute little area.very clean, and the staff is SO NICE!!! only thing is having to carry all your luggage up the stairs, but that seems to be the trend in europe, no elevators! haha the bathroom was TINY! but it was good enough for showering. breakfast was simple and was basically just cereal and juices which was good enough. close to internet cafes and other convienence spots. big windows in the room..i would stay here again!
Reviews.Author: cindylouwho

Reviews.Content: Good location Very close to the train station. My friend and I got the room downstairs near the breakfast area. The room was very basic, not great, but decent. Shower was like something from an old apartment with a mildew shower curtain which didn't drain well. The worst part was when we arrived the door was wide open and there were a ton of mosquitoes in the room, and mosquitoes would end up in the room at the end of the day. A/C did not work. I thought the neighborhood was fine.
Reviews.Author: aeropostale

Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for! You get what you pay for: good price for the location. Our room overlooked the street and was noisy (earplugs were good!). The shower cubicle in the bathroom not v. clean.... Breakfast was poor: weak coffee and not much in the way of food on offer. The orange juice was cordial. Access is up a flight of approx. 30 stairs so not suitable for anyone with mobility problems (unless there's another entrance we didn't see). Staff on reception varied from the very friendly and English-speaking to downright surly with seemingly no understanding of English. I don't expect everyone to speak my language, but when you try a few faltering words of Italian and just get an uninterested blank look in return, it isn't good in a service environment!
Reviews.Author: Grecofan

Reviews.Content: Location, Value, No Problems       Our Room
Reviews.Author: Vitaminbees

Reviews.Content: not great       the bed and a/c unit
Reviews.Author: jrittenour

Reviews.Content: Basic but good value for the location OK, it was never going to be a luxury hotel for what I paid, which was 拢90 or 134 Euros or $180 for two nights bed and breakfast for two people. I think that is really good value frankly. I regularly stay in London on my own and my company limits me to a maximum of 拢100 per night for a hotel and it is extremely difficult to find one for that price. Anyway, the hotel wasn't dirty but it could have done with a spruce up. The air conditioning in our room didn't work. A trip to the desk got a very helpful caretaker to come and look at it and fix it. Silly us for not realising there was an on/off switch hidden behind a curtain on the other side of the room. Doh! When it was working it was quiet and effective. The TV didn't work very well. Grainy picture and no obvious way to change channels (no remote). But I didn't go to Florence to watch the TV so I really didn't care.I saw the bathrooms that other reviewers have mentioned, the ones where water goes everywhere. Our room was en-suite (for 拢45 per night!) though and the shower was a perfectly decent cubicle type. I think the wet room ones are just the communal ones (yuk!). I didn't bother with breakfast as I was always too full of wine and pizza from the previous night. My partner did though and she said that the coffee was nasty and cold. The food was prepackaged buns and stuff. Glad i didn't bother really.The location of this place is definitely a winner though. It's 5 minutes from the train station and 10 minutes from the centre of Florence if you stroll gently past the many restaurants and bars and interesting shops. Brilliant location.All in all I think it was fantastic value if all you want is somewhere to bed down for the night. If you want a hotel room to live in, pay more.
Reviews.Author: carlyoungcat

Reviews.Content: Budget Hotel, but it was OK this hotel was definitely very budget, but was only 2 blocks from main train station, and walking distance to Ponte Vecchio and other main attractions. My husband  I stayed here, we're in our early 30's, so it wasn't bad for us. The neighborhood isn't the best, but had a great little market on the corner, and a local bar down the street, Public Place, where the local college exchange students hung out. They served a decent breakfast every morning, and had an A/C with decent size rooms. Yes, the shower is completely open and is part of the whole bathroom, but it wasn't a problem for us. For the price, it's OK. If you're looking for something budget but decent, this will work for you. We were there 2 days and experienced no problems. There are a flight of stairs to get to the lobby, so you'll have to deal with that. Otherwise, it was cool. It's different, but then again, added to our overall traveling experience. It's not the Westin, but it's not a fleabag hotel either. You'll be alright... San Diego, CALIFORNIA.
Reviews.Author: Wine_Lovers225

Reviews.Content: Dirty Hotel - Beware Please be advised that this one-star hotel was disgusting. I arrived and found dirt and mildew in my shower, hair in my bed and a dead bug on the wall. When I asked them to change my sheets, they handed me a sheet to do it myself. The graffiti-filled neighborhood was very run-down and as a single, female traveler, I felt unsafe. Had I not had a friend to stay with at another hotel, this hotel would have ruined my trip to Florence.
Reviews.Author: semond

Reviews.Content: Interesting bathroom; lots of stairs! This hotel was ok for our needs, however I do have a few warnings. We had quite a bit of heavy luggage, and there are several flights of stairs to negotiate. Also, the bathrooms were interesting. There is no shower curtain or even separation between the shower and the rest of the bathroom. So, we had to clear everything out of the bathroom when time came to take a shower. I recommend you ask for extra towels to block the door so the water doesn't seep into the room. The hotel is very near the train station, which was convenient for arrival and departure. Luckily, Florence is pretty compact, so the walk to the main tourist sites wasn't a problem for us. However, some travellers might prefer to be closer in.
Reviews.Author: Zoecat601
